abstracts.cdata!:
The Export Industries Project for the
            former Socialist Federal Republic of Yugoslavia (SFRY) was
            approved by the Board on June 29, 1988, but was never
            signed. Following an exchange of correspondence with the
            proposed borrowers, the Bank notified them on August 25,
            1989 that it had withdrawn its offer to enter into the
            loans. The delay in signing and eventual cancellation was
            linked to the evolution of economic policies and
            circumstances in the former SFRY. High interest rates and
            expected changes in the structure of the banking and
            enterprise sectors led to a marked slackening in demand for
            investment credits. The circumstances in the former SFRY
            could not have been anticipated at the time of project approval.
